classes the first our OLTP style graph reads which we define as parameterised
lookups a parameter I've graph queries of less than three hops and for these
the neptune performance targets are to support up to 10,000 OLTP queries per
server per second with horizontal read scaling with support for up to 15
different read replicas and then the second class of queries that we think about are more OLAP style queries and we
define these as parameterised graph traversals of three or more hops on bound graph patterns combinations of
those with complex filters and for these kinds of OLAP queries our target is to

of transactional they'll do it in an object model way where they'll create objects and then store them directly into the data model so in general it's
like an ETL process where you take a look at the source data that you're coming from you decide of the tables in
the source data which ones represent entities which things represent relationships and then you put those
into for property graph CSV based serialization or for RDF graphs Neptune
supports four different RDF C realizations in the
